  • Constructor Details

    • MainGame

      public MainGame(boolean isHost, GameState gameState)
      Initializes the MainGame instance, setting up either a host or a client based on the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      isHost - Specifies if this instance is hosting the game. true if hosting, false if a client.
      gameState - The initial game state to initialize the game for the client. null for host initialization.

    • MainGame

      public MainGame(GameController gameController)
      Alternative constructor for MainGame, primarily used for initializing with an existing GameController.
      Parameters:
      gameController - The GameController instance to associate with this MainGame.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFromGameState

      public void initializeFromGameState(GameState gameState)
      Initializes the game state from a provided GameState object. This method updates the game board, game controller, token data, and player labels.
      Parameters:
      gameState - The GameState object containing the game board, players, current player index, and token data to synchronize the client with the host.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point of the game application. Presents the user with options to play locally, host a game, or join a game.

      Based on the user's choice, this method initializes the game in one of three modes:

      • Play Locally: Starts a game instance for local play.
      • Host a Game: Sets up the game as the host and waits for clients to join.
      • Join a Game: Connects to a host and joins the game as a client.
      If the user cancels or closes the dialog, the program exits.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used in this application).

    • createAndShowGame

      public void createAndShowGame(MainGame mainGame)
      Initializes and displays the game window, setting up the user interface components. This method creates a JFrame and uses a JLayeredPane to layer multiple panels for the game, including the background, grid, logo, game area, insert panel, and chat box. It performs the following actions:
      • Creates a JFrame for the game window.
      • Sets up a layered pane to manage the layout of different components.
      • Adds a background panel at the bottom layer.
      • Places a grid panel on top of the background.
      • Adds a chat panel in the bottom-right corner of the window.
      • Creates and positions a logo panel at the top of the window.
      • Sets up a game area panel for gameplay elements.
      • Adds an insert panel for inputting grid elements.
      • Creates a menu bar and adds it to the frame.
      The frame is then packed to fit the components, centered on the screen, and made non-resizable. Finally, the frame is made visible.

    • setController

      public void setController(GameController controller)
      Sets the game controller for this game instance.
      Parameters:
      controller - the GameController to set.

    • getGridPanel

      public JPanel getGridPanel()
      Retrieves the grid panel representing the game board's grid.
      Returns:
      the JPanel representing the grid panel.

    • isHost

      public boolean isHost()
      Checks if the current game instance is running as the host.
      Returns:
      true if the game instance is the host, false otherwise.

    • getAssignedPlayerIndex

      public int getAssignedPlayerIndex()
      Retrieves the assigned player index for the current game instance.
      Returns:
      the index of the player assigned to this instance.

    • getTokenMap

      public Map<Point,JLabel> getTokenMap()
      Retrieves the token map that associates positions on the grid with token labels.
      Returns:
      a Map where keys are Point objects representing positions, and values are JLabel objects representing tokens.

    • getLayeredPane

      public JLayeredPane getLayeredPane()
      Retrieves the layered pane used for managing tokens and other layered UI components.
      Returns:
      the JLayeredPane for managing layered UI elements.

    • getNetworkManager

      public NetworkManager getNetworkManager()
      Retrieves the network manager responsible for managing network interactions.
      Returns:
      the NetworkManager instance managing the network.

    • getGameBoard

      public GameBoard getGameBoard()
      Retrieves the game board object representing the current game state.
      Returns:
      the GameBoard representing the current game board.

    • getTokenData

      public Map<Point,String> getTokenData()
      Retrieves the token data for the current game state. This method creates a mapping of grid positions to the file paths of the token images at those positions. It is used for synchronizing token data between game instances.
      Returns:
      a Map where keys are Point objects representing positions on the grid, and values are String objects representing the file paths of the token images.

    • getCellSize

      public int getCellSize()
      Retrieves the size of each cell in the grid.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the size of a grid cell in pixels.

    • getMagicalComponentLabels

      public Map<String,JLabel> getMagicalComponentLabels()
      Retrieves the map of magical component labels. This method returns a mapping of magical component file paths to their associated JLabels. It is used for managing the state and display of magical components in the game.
      Returns:
      a Map where keys are String objects representing magical component file paths, and values are JLabel objects representing the UI labels for those components.

    • getChatArea

      public JTextArea getChatArea()

    • updateTurnLabel

      public void updateTurnLabel(int currentPlayerIndex)
      Updates the turn label to reflect the current player's turn. This method modifies the currentPlayerLabel to indicate which player's turn it is. The label is updated with the player's index (1-based) to display a message like "Player X's Turn".
      Parameters:
      currentPlayerIndex - the index of the current player (0-based).

    • updateTurnIndicator

      public void updateTurnIndicator(int currentPlayerIndex)
      Updates the turn indicator to visually highlight the current player. This method adjusts the appearance of player star labels to highlight the current player's stars while dimming others. The highlighting is done by changing the text color of the current player's label.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayerIndex - the index of the current player (0-based).

    • updatePlayerStars

      public void updatePlayerStars(int playerIndex, int newStarCount)
      Updates the star count for a specific player. This method updates the star count displayed for a given player by modifying the associated JLabel. The star count is represented using Unicode star characters (`★`). If the provided player index is invalid, the method logs an error and exits without making changes.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player (0-based) whose stars are to be updated.
      newStarCount - the new star count for the player (non-negative).

    • collectTokenIfPresent

      public void collectTokenIfPresent(int playerIndex, Point position)
      Collects a token at the specified position for the current player. This method checks if there is a token at the provided position. If found, it removes the token from the UI and updates the player's star count. If the token is a magic card, it applies a grayscale effect to its corresponding magic card label and updates its status. After processing the token, the game state is broadcasted to all clients if the game is hosted on the server.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player collecting the token (0-based).
      position - the Point position on the grid where the token is located.

    • createTokenLabel

      public JLabel createTokenLabel(String tokenPath, int tokenSize)
      Creates a JLabel representing a token on the game board. The method loads a token image from the specified file path, resizes it to fit the specified token size, and applies it to a JLabel. The token's file path is stored as the description of the associated ImageIcon.
      Parameters:
      tokenPath - the file path of the token's image.
      tokenSize - the size (in pixels) of the token icon.
      Returns:
      a JLabel displaying the token.

    • updatePlayerPosition

      public void updatePlayerPosition(int playerIndex, Point newPosition)
      Updates the UI position of a player's piece on the game board. This method calculates the new pixel coordinates of the player's piece based on the given grid position and updates the corresponding JLabel to reflect the new position on the screen. The label's position is adjusted to center the player icon within the grid cell.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player whose position is being updated.
      newPosition - the new grid position of the player as a Point.

    • canHostAct

      public boolean canHostAct(int assignedPlayerIndex, int currentPlayerIndex, boolean isHost)
      Determines if the host or client can perform an action based on the turn. This method ensures that: - The host can only act as Player 1 (with `assignedPlayerIndex == 0`). - In a host-client setup, a player can only act during their turn.
      Parameters:
      assignedPlayerIndex - the index of the player assigned to this host or client.
      currentPlayerIndex - the index of the player whose turn it is.
      isHost - a boolean indicating whether the player is the host.
      Returns:
      true if the player can act; false otherwise.

    • showInvalidMoveDialog

      public void showInvalidMoveDialog()
      Displays a dialog box informing the user of an invalid move. This method is invoked when a player attempts to move to an invalid tile, such as one that is occupied or out of bounds. The dialog displays a warning message with details about the issue.

    • getInsertPanel

      public JPanel getInsertPanel()
      Retrieves the insert panel used for tile manipulation. The insert panel is a UI component that displays the currently selected tile and provides the functionality to insert it into the game grid. This method returns the panel for use in other parts of the application.
      Returns:
      a JPanel representing the insert panel.

    • hostGame

      public void hostGame()
      Hosts a multiplayer game by starting a server. This method prompts the user to input a port number and initializes the game for hosting. It sets up the token data, creates an initial game state, and starts the host server on the specified port. The network manager is also configured for managing client connections. If hosting is successful, the game UI is launched, and the server begins listening for client connections.

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame()
      Joins a multiplayer game hosted on a server. This method prompts the user to input the host's IP address and port number. It establishes a connection to the server, retrieves the game state, and initializes the client-side game. The game controller and network manager are configured for handling updates and interactions during the game. If the connection is successful, the client UI is launched, and the game state is synchronized with the host.

    • syncState

      public void syncState(GameState state)
      Synchronizes the client game state with the received game state from the host. This method updates the game board tiles, player positions, and the current player index based on the provided `GameState` object. It also synchronizes the token data and refreshes the UI to reflect the updated game state.
      Parameters:
      state - the `GameState` object containing the updated game state from the host.

    • updateUI

      public void updateUI()
      Updates the user interface to reflect the current game state. This method refreshes the game area panel, grid panel, and other visual components to display the latest game state. It also updates the turn indicator and current player label to highlight the current player's turn.
